segments.text: I see the water just pouring out of the sink, and no one is doing anything about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is drying dishes like everything is fine, but the floor is getting flooded.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the children are being sneaky, but the water is the real problem here.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cabinets are getting soaked, and I think the wood is going to warp.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool the boy is on looks like it’s about to tip, but the water is the bigger issue.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe she hasn’t turned off the faucet yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole kitchen is going to be ruined if this keeps up.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’ll even notice before the damage is done.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is spreading fast, and it’s only going to get worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think someone needs to step in before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR
